moduleconfig:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-16" ?>
<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
	<moduleName>Slaverun Reloaded V3 SE Beta 1</moduleName>
	<installSteps order="Explicit">
		<installStep name="Main and optionals">
			<optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
				<group name="Install main mod" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins>
						<plugin name="Slaverun Reloaded">
							<description>
								Installs the Slaverun Reloaded main mod for Skyrim SE.
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder source="SlaverunReloaded" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="Install comments?" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins>
						<plugin name="Slaverun Reloaded Comments">
							<description>
								Installs the optional comment module. This requires Sexlab - Sexual Fame Framework and its dependencies. The base mod will function normally without the comments, but comments will also work without main mod.
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder source="SlaverunReloaded Comments" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="Install alternative json config for Apachii Hairstyles?" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins>
						<plugin name="Slaverun Json config for ApachiiSky">
							<description>
								Installs a slaverun.json file in which haircuts of ApachiiSky are used. Only use this if you have ApachiiSkyHair and ApachiiSkyHairFemale installed.
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder source="SlaverunReloadedApacheHairs" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="Install patch for Apropos Classic 2017 03 02 01" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins>
						<plugin name="Apropos Classic 2017 03 02 01 Patch">
							<description>
								Installs a small patch for apropos to prevent a CTD in the (optional) beheading scene after a lost arena fight. Don't install if you don't use apropos or don't want that beheading anyway!
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder source="Apropos Classic 2017 03 02 01 Patch" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="Install Slaverun crawling animations" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins>
						<plugin name="SlaverunCrawlingAnimation">
							<description>
								Installs animation files to enable crawling feature in Slaverun Reloaded (with credits to DarkAngel1265 (https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33097).
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder source="SlaverunCrawlingAnimation" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
	</installSteps>
</config>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
	<moduleName>MYSLALPACK v12.0</moduleName>
	<installSteps order="Explicit">
		<installStep name="Custom">
			<optionalFileGroups>
				<group name="Modules" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="1. Beastly Human Animations">
							<description>
								All these pack contains mix animation categorized using certain tags that FunnyBizness made. Tags are mentioned in their respective description.
								Contains Human Animations of Beastly Category (Tag to play these animation is Beastly)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="01-HumanBeastly" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="2. Bound Human Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Bound Human Animations (Tag to play these animation is Bound)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="02-HumanBound" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="3. FemaleDomination Human Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Dominative Female Human Animations (Tag to play these animation is FemDom)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="03-HumanFemDom" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="4. Human Animations with Furniture">
							<description>
								Contains Animations with Furniture Equipped to Actors. (Tag to play these animation is AnimObject)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="04-HumanFun" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="5. Human Group Animations">
							<description>
								Contains 3way, 4way and 5way  Human Animations
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="05-HumanGroup" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="6. Guro Human Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Human Animations of Guro Category (Tag to play these animation is Guro)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="06-HumanGuro" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="7. Lover Human Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Human Animations of Lover Category (Tag to play these animation is Loving)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="07-HumanLover" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="8. Molag Human Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Human Animations of Molag Category (Tag to play these animation is Molag)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="08-HumanMolag" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="9. Necro Human Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Human Animations of Necro Category (Tag to play these animation is Necro)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="09-HumanNecro" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="10. Rape Human Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Human Animations of Rape Category (Tag to play these animation is FBRape)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="10-HumanRape" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="11. Uncategorised Human Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Various Human Animations that didn't fit in any of the above Category (Tag to play these animation is UC)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="11-HumanUn" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="12. AnimObjects">
							<description>
								Contains the props used by Many Animations and is compatible with Anub's one. Just Overwrite his with mine.
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="12-AnimObjects" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="13. Male Creature Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Creatures(Male) animations
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="13-MaleCreatures" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="14. Female Creature Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Creatures(Female) animations
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="14-FemaleCreatures" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="15. Human Masturbation Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Human Masturbation Animations only
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="15-HumanMasturbation" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
							<plugin name="16. Amputee Animations">
							<description>
								Contains Animations which are meant to be played with Amputated Body Parts (Tag to play these animation is Amputee)
							</description>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="16-Amputee" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
	</installSteps>
</config>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
	<moduleName>The Particle Patch for ENB</moduleName>
	<installSteps order="Explicit">
		<installStep name="Installation">
			<optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
				<group name="Installation type" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="BSA">
							<description>
								Core assets are provided as a BSA. The advantage is that loose files from other mods will always take priority, making sure that those mods can function correctly without managing load order manually. Note that optional custom textures and any meshes required by them will be still provided as loose files so that you can manage their priority appropriately.

Additionally, Particle Patch for ENB.esp plugin containing fixes to Fire FX shaders is installed.
							</description>
								<image path="img/01.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="bsa">active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Loose Files">
							<description>
								Core assets are provided as loose files instead of a BSA in case you want to manage their priority manually. Additionally, the Particle Patch for ENB.esp plugin containing fixes to Fire FX shaders is installed.
							</description>
								<image path="img/01.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="bsa">inactive</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="Light Shafts" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Yes">
							<description>
								Light shafts can be controlled by [PARTICLE] settings of ENBSeries but as a downside they will appear slightly different, whether or not they look better or worse is subjective.

Example image with custom textures active.
							</description>
								<image path="img/02b.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="ambient">active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="No">
							<description>
								Lights shafts are not modified anyhow and cannot be controlled with [PARTICLE] settings of ENBSeries so they may appear too bright depending on your preset and weather mod.

Example image with custom textures active.
							</description>
								<image path="img/02a.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="ambient">inactive</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="Fake Light Glow" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Particle Light">
							<description>
								Render glow as particle light.

In the preview image, before (vanilla) is on top and after is at bottom.
							</description>
								<image path="img/03a.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="noglow">inactive</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin><plugin name="Remove">
							<description>
								Remove glow completely.

In the preview image, before (vanilla) is on top and after is at bottom.
							</description>
								<image path="img/03b.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="noglow">active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="Custom textures" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Yes">
							<description>
								Choose this if you want to install custom textures. Mostly these are improved (somewhat subjective, obviously), higher resolution textures for a number particle effects such as ambient fog, mist and light shafts but also custom 4K cobwebs and some other minor things. Custom textures always come as loose files.
							</description>
								<image path="img/01.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="tex">active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="No">
							<description>
								Choose this if you do not want to install custom textures.
							</description>
								<image path="img/01.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="tex">inactive</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
	</installSteps>
	<conditionalFileInstalls>
        <patterns>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="active"/>
					<flagDependency flag="ambient" value="active"/>
                </dependencies>
				<files>
                    <folder source="assets/bsa" destination="" priority="1"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="inactive"/>
					<flagDependency flag="ambient" value="active"/>
                </dependencies>
				<files>
                    <folder source="assets/loose" destination="" priority="1"/>
					<folder source="assets/ambient" destination="" priority="1"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="active"/>
					<flagDependency flag="ambient" value="inactive"/>
                </dependencies>
				<files>
                    <folder source="assets/bsa-nobeams" destination="" priority="1"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="inactive"/>
					<flagDependency flag="ambient" value="inactive"/>
                </dependencies>
				<files>
                    <folder source="assets/loose" destination="" priority="1"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="active"/>
					<flagDependency flag="ambient" value="active"/>
					<flagDependency flag="noglow" value="active"/>
                </dependencies>
				<files>
                    <folder source="assets/bsa-noglow" destination="" priority="2"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="inactive"/>
					<flagDependency flag="ambient" value="active"/>
					<flagDependency flag="noglow" value="active"/>
                </dependencies>
				<files>
                    <folder source="assets/loose" destination="" priority="1"/>
					<folder source="assets/ambient" destination="" priority="1"/>
					<folder source="assets/noglow" destination="" priority="2"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="active"/>
					<flagDependency flag="ambient" value="inactive"/>
					<flagDependency flag="noglow" value="active"/>
                </dependencies>
				<files>
                    <folder source="assets/bsa-nobeams-noglow" destination="" priority="2"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="inactive"/>
					<flagDependency flag="ambient" value="inactive"/>
					<flagDependency flag="noglow" value="active"/>
                </dependencies>
				<files>
                    <folder source="assets/loose" destination="" priority="1"/>
					<folder source="assets/noglow" destination="" priority="2"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="tex" value="active"/>
                </dependencies>
                <files>
                    <folder source="assets/tex" destination="" priority="1"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="Or">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="active"/>
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="inactive"/>
                </dependencies>
                <files>
                    <folder source="plugin" destination="" priority="1"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="inactive"/>
					<fileDependency file="ccQDRSSE002-Firewood.esl" state="Active"/>
				</dependencies>
                <files>
                    <folder source="assets/campfire" destination="" priority="1"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
			<pattern>
                <dependencies operator="And">
					<flagDependency flag="bsa" value="inactive"/>
					<fileDependency file="ccbgssse069-contest.esl" state="Active"/>
				</dependencies>
                <files>
                    <folder source="assets/webmother" destination="" priority="1"/>
                </files>
            </pattern>
		</patterns>
    </conditionalFileInstalls>
</config>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
	<moduleName>SexLab Utility Plus</moduleName>
	<moduleDependencies>
		<fileDependency file="Skyrim.esm" state="Active" />
		<fileDependency file="SexLab.esm" state="Active" />
	</moduleDependencies>
	<installSteps order="Explicit">	
		<installStep name="Core Setup">
			<optionalFileGroups>
				<group name="CORE Commond" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="CORE">
							<description>
								Required files.
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod\Logo.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="CoreDefault">Active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder source="00_Core" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Required"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>   
				</group>
				<group name="CORE Conditional" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">			
						<plugin name="Legendary Edition">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[Install the required files for the Skyrim Legendary Edition SexLab Framework.]]>
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod\Logo.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="LE">Active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder source="01_Core\LE" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="Optional"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<fileDependency file="Unofficial Skyrim Patch.esp" state="Active" />
												<fileDependency file="Unofficial Skyrim Legendary Edition Patch.esp" state="Active" />
												<gameDependency version="1.9.32.0" />
											</dependencies>
											<type name="Recommended"/>
										</pattern>
									</patterns>
								</dependencyType>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Special Edition">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[Install the required files for the Skyrim Special Edition SexLab Framework.]]>
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod\Logo.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="SE">Active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder source="01_Core\SE" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="Optional"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies>
												<gameDependency version="1.5.97.0" />
											</dependencies>
											<type name="Recommended"/>
										</pattern>
									</patterns>
								</dependencyType>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Aniversary Edition">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[Install the required files for the Skyrim Aniversary Edition SexLab Framework.]]>
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod\Logo.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="SE">Active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder source="01_Core\AE" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="Optional"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies>
												<gameDependency version="1.6.317.0" />
											</dependencies>
											<type name="Recommended"/>
										</pattern>
									</patterns>
								</dependencyType>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>   
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
		<installStep name="Special Edition Optional">
			<visible>
				<flagDependency flag="SE" value="Active" />
			</visible>
			<optionalFileGroups>
				<group name="Options" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">			
						<plugin name="None">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[If you don't want use the Extra funtions like "Use Furniture" for furniture animations.
	Recomended for slow machines.
***REQUIRED EXECUTE "Clean System" option in SexLab Framework MCM once installed to avoid CTD, unless you be updating from the previous version, in which just "Rebuild the Expression Registry" to fix possible issues with the "Fix Lips" option***
**Also is recomended "Export the Configuration" before update the files and "Import the Configuration" once the "Clean System" end with the update, to be able to keep the configuration**]]>
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod\Logo.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="No_Patch">Active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Extra">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[If you want to use the Extra funtions like "Use Furniture" or increase the max animations count from 750 to 1250.
	Recomended to improve the immersive experience.
***REQUIRED EXECUTE "Clean System" option in SexLab Framework MCM once installed to avoid CTD, unless you be updating from the previous version, in which just "Rebuild the Expression Registry" to fix possible issues with the "Fix Lips" option***
**Also is recomended "Export the Configuration" before update the files and "Import the Configuration" once the "Clean System" end with the update, to be able to keep the configuration**]]>
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod\Logo.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Extra_Patch">Active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder source="02_Extra\SE" destination=""/>
								<folder source="03_Plugins\SE" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Extra (without animations)">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[If you want to use the Extra funtions like "Use Furniture" but can't increase the max animations count from 750 to 1250.
	Recomended to improve the immersive experience.
***REQUIRED EXECUTE "Clean System" option in SexLab Framework MCM once installed to avoid CTD, unless you be updating from the previous version, in which just "Rebuild the Expression Registry" to fix possible issues with the "Fix Lips" option***
**Also is recomended "Export the Configuration" before update the files and "Import the Configuration" once the "Clean System" end with the update, to be able to keep the configuration**]]>
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod\Logo.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
	<moduleName>Hunterborn</moduleName>
	<requiredInstallFiles>
		<folder source="00 Core" destination=""/>
	</requiredInstallFiles>
	
	<installSteps order="Explicit">
		<installStep name="Custom">
			<optionalFileGroups>
			
				<group name="Compatibility Patches" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins>
					
						<plugin name="Campfire">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[
								Adds recipes for bone arrows using deadwood, and for the mortar and pestle using animal bones.
								]]>
							</description>
							<image path=""/>
							<files>
								<folder source="41 Campfire" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies>
												<fileDependency file="Campfire.esm" state="Active"/>
											</dependencies>
											<type name="Recommended"/>
										</pattern>
									</patterns>
								</dependencyType>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						
						<plugin name="iNeed">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[
								Adds the recipe for 'water', using iNeed's waterskins, used for Hunterborn soups and stews.
								]]>
							</description>
							<image path=""/>
							<files>
								<file source="44 iNeed\Hunterborn - iNeed Patch.esp" destination="Hunterborn - iNeed Patch.esp"/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies>
												<fileDependency file="iNeed.esp" state="Active"/>
											</dependencies>
											<type name="Recommended"/>
										</pattern>
									</patterns>
								</dependencyType>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						
					</plugins>
				</group>

				<group name="Optional Patches" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins>
					
						<plugin name="Leather Requires Tanning">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[
								Changes vanilla recipes for leather to now require either animal fat, or tree bark. Tree bark is acquired by foraging for wood.
								]]>
							</description>
							<image path=""/>
							<files>
								<file source="42 Leather\Hunterborn - Leather Tanning.esp" destination="Hunterborn - Leather Tanning.esp"/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					
						<plugin name="Soups and Stews">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[
								A custom crafting system that allows you to combine any different meats and vegetables in any order, plus seasonings, mushrooms, and flour. This adds 5,560 unique soups, and 24,661 recipes to craft them. This feature needs to be enabled from the Hunterborn config menu.
								]]>
							</description>
							<image path=""/>
							<files>
								<file source="43 Soups and Stews\Hunterborn - Soups and Stews.esp" destination="Hunterborn - Soups and Stews.esp"/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						
						<plugin name="iNeed Soup Fix">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[
								This is an optional, additional iNeed patch, if you're using the Hunterborn Soups and Stews feature. This patch replaces an iNeed script file, patching in automatic recognition of all 5,560 soups, so you won't be prompted for each unique one. IMPORTANT: Because this is a loose file, you may need to remove it later (uninstall or reinstall Hunterborn from NMM) if you update iNeed.
								]]>
							</description>
							<image path=""/>
							<files>
								<file source="44 iNeed\_snplayeralias.pex" destination="Scripts\_snplayeralias.pex"/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies>
												<fileDependency file="iNeed.esp" state="Active"/>
											</dependencies>
											<type name="Optional"/>
										</pattern>
									</patterns>
								</dependencyType>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						
					</plugins>					
				</group>
					
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
	</installSteps>
</config>

					<plugins order="Explicit"> 
						<plugin name="Remove Clouds"> 
							<description>Replaces the map clouds with empty models. This will cause no clouds to be displayed on the map. I recommend this as the clouds can block the view of objects on the map. 

Optionally, you could skip this and install A Quality World Map's Clear Map Skies optional file, but there are places such as Castle Volkihar which are obscured from view using that.</description> 
							<image path="images\clouds options.jpg" /> 
							<files> 
								<folder source="300 No Clouds" destination="" priority="0" /> 
							</files> 
							<typeDescriptor> 
								<type name="Recommended"/> 
							</typeDescriptor> 
						</plugin> 
					</plugins> 
				</group> 
			</optionalFileGroups> 
		</installStep> 
		<installStep name="Patches"> 
			<optionalFileGroups order="Explicit"> 
				<group name="Patches" type="SelectAny"> 
					<plugins order="Explicit"> 
						<plugin name="Worldspace Transition Tweaks"> 
							<description>Patch for use with Worldspace Transition Tweaks (https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/48889) by AndrealphusVIII.</description> 
							<image path="images\Worldspace Transition Tweaks.jpg" /> 
							<files> 
								<folder source="501 Worldspace Transition Tweaks" destination="" priority="0" /> 
							</files> 
							<typeDescriptor> 
								<dependencyType> 
									<defaultType name="Optional"/> 
									<patterns> 
										<pattern> 
											<dependencies operator="And"> 
												<fileDependency file="WTT - Skyrim-Solstheim - Worldsettings.esp" state="Active"/> 
											</dependencies> 
											<type name="Recommended"/> 
										</pattern> 
									</patterns> 
								</dependencyType> 
							</typeDescriptor> 
						</plugin> 
					</plugins> 
				</group> 
			</optionalFileGroups> 
		</installStep> 
	</installSteps> 
</config>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
	<moduleName>Water for ENB</moduleName>
	<installSteps order="Explicit">
		<installStep name="Water Color | iNeed Support">
			<optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
				<group name="Water Color" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Shades of Skyrim">
							<description>
								Unique water color and wave style for a number of different regions and locations. Also features custom creeks with "real" water. Vanilla style moderate waves for flowing rivers with high detail. Removes water flow from large bodies of water but maintains it for large rivers. 
							</description>
								<image path="img/09.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
                                <flag name="Shades">active</flag>
								<flag name="BlueShades">active</flag>
								<flag name="LessTransparent">inactive</flag>
								<flag name="Waterfalls">inactive</flag>
								<flag name="RiftenMod">inactive</flag>	
								<flag name="Lakewater">inactive</flag>	
								<flag name="Underwater">inactive</flag>	
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Nordic Blue">
							<description>
								Vanilla style moderate waves for flowing rivers with high detail. Removes water flow from large bodies of water but maintains it for large rivers. 
							</description>
								<image path="img/03.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Blue">active</flag>
								<flag name="BlueShades">active</flag>
								<flag name="Waterfalls">inactive</flag>																
								<flag name="Underwater">inactive</flag>	
                                <flag name="Shades">inactive</flag>								
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Mineral Teal">
							<description>
								Vanilla style moderate waves for flowing rivers with high detail. Removes water flow from large bodies of water but maintains it for large rivers.

����Not all patches are available for this water color option.
							</description>
								<image path="img/08.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
                                <flag name="Teal">active</flag>
								<flag name="Waterfalls">inactive</flag>																
								<flag name="Underwater">inactive</flag>	
                                <flag name="Shades">inactive</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Tropical Green">
							<description>
								Vanilla style moderate waves for flowing rivers with high detail. Removes water flow from large bodies of water but maintains it for large rivers.

����Not all patches are available for this water color option.
							</description>
								<image path="img/07.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
                                <flag name="Green">active</flag>
								<flag name="Waterfalls">inactive</flag>																
								<flag name="Underwater">inactive</flag>	
                                <flag name="Shades">inactive</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Vanilla">
							<description>
								Vanilla style moderate waves for flowing rivers with high detail. Removes water flow from large bodies of water but maintains it for large rivers.

����Not all patches are available for this water color option.
							</description>
								<image path="img/04.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Vanilla">active</flag>
								<flag name="Waterfalls">inactive</flag>
								<flag name="Underwater">inactive</flag>	
                                <flag name="Shades">inactive</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Wavy Rivers">
							<description>
								Wavy waves for rivers. Choose this option if you want the rivers to have higher waves and as smooth distant water transition as possible. Please keep in mind that vanilla style river water flow will be disabled and thus rivers may flow to odd directions. Also, as a downside all water will look pretty much the same.

����Not all patches are available for this water color option.
							</description>
								<image path="img/04.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Wavy">active</flag>
								<flag name="Waterfalls">inactive</flag>								
								<flag name="Underwater">inactive</flag>	
                                <flag name="Shades">inactive</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="iNeed" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="No Legacy iNeed Support">
							<description>
								You're not using any legacy needs or bathing mods. Note that mods needs mods have been already updated to use an SKSE plugin so if you're not sure, please double-check the description of the mod(s) you're using.
							</description>
								<image path="img/01.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="iNeed">inactive</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Legacy iNeed Support">
							<description>
								Choose this option if you use legacy needs mods like iNeed - Food Water and Sleep, Keep it Clean - A Bathing Mod or Realistic Needs and Diseases 2.0 and the like. If you use newer or updated needs mods that rely on an SKSE plugin like iNeed Continued you should not choose this option but the default.
							</description>
								<image path="img/01.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="iNeed">active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
		<installStep name="Resolution | LOD Brightness">
		<optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
				<group name="Texture Resolution" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="4K">
							<description>
								4K textures for highest quality displacement. This install step determines the resolution of the core water assets that are used for tessellation and displacement. Higher resolution textures will yield smoother water animation and reduce jittering (pixelated noise when there's not enough resolution) but can cause reduced performance.
							</description>
								<image path="img/01.jpg"/>
							<files>
								<folder source="textures-4K" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="textures-4K">active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="2K">
							<description>
								2K textures for best performance. This install step determines the resolution of the core water assets that are used for tessellation and displacement. Lower resolution textures will yield better performance at the cost of not as smooth water animation and introduction of some jittering.
							</description>
								<image path="img/02.jpg"/>
							<files>
								<folder source="textures-2K" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="textures-2K">active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>				
				<group name="LOD Brightness" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Neutral">
							<description>
								This works the best with the suggested settings to make sure the seam is as inconspicuous as possible.
							</description>
								<image path="img/14.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="DefaultLOD">active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Darker">
							<description>
								Choose this option if your ENB preset is tuned for darker water by for example increasing FresnelAmount. Not compatible with Mineral Teal or Tropical Green options.
							</description>
								<image path="img/15.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="DarkLOD">active</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Blue" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Wavy" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Teal" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
		<installStep name="Waterfalls And Effects Add-On">
			<optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
				<group name="Style" type="SelectAtMostOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Transparent">
							<description>
								The default choice of more transparent waterfalls, probably yielding a better illusion of moving water.
							</description>
							<image path="img/05b.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Waterfalls">active</flag>
								<flag name="LegacyWaterfalls">inactive</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Opaque">
							<description>
								More opaque waterfalls that are richer in color.
							</description>
							<image path="img/05a.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Waterfalls">active</flag>
								<flag name="LegacyWaterfalls">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="Resolution" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Descending">
						<plugin name="4K">
							<description>
								A visual overhaul of waterfalls and most related effects. Also includes fixes to prevent the waterfalls and related effects from glowing at night. 4K resolution for highest quality.
							</description>
								<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Waterfalls4K">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>	
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="2K">
							<description>
								A visual overhaul of waterfalls and most related effects. Also includes fixes to prevent the waterfalls and related effects from glowing at night. 2K resolution for best performance.
							</description>
								<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Waterfalls2K">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>	
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>	
				</group>
				<group name="Parallax" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Descending">
						<plugin name="Parallax">
							<description>
								Choose if you're using parallax.
							</description>
								<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Parallax">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>	
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="No Parallax">
							<description>
								Choose if you don't use parallax.
							</description>
								<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="NoParallax">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>	
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>	
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>		
		<installStep name="Patches and Other Bits">
			<optionalFileGroups>
				<group name="Customization" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins order="Ascending">
						<plugin name="Blue Rift Water (SOS)">
							<description>
								Reverts the water around Riften to default blue shade so it will match distant LOD water. Shades of Skyrim only.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="RiftenMod">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Alternate Lake Water (SOS)">
							<description>
								Although the current lake water "style" should result in a less obvious seam between the high detailed water and LOD water, it will also affect how the water looks, making it less serene, so here's an option to revert the lake water to how it was pre 1.88 in case you prefer that even with the more obvious seam.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Lakewater">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Better Underwater Visibility">
							<description>
								Increases underwater viewing distance for better visibility.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="Underwater">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Vanilla Cubemaps (SOS)">
							<description>
								Choose this in case you would rather use the vanilla cubemaps for water reflections instead of the custom ones provided by Water for ENB. Shades of Skyrim only.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="VanillaCubemaps">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Black Cubemaps">
							<description>
								Choose this if you are planning to take advantage of Dynamic Cubemaps feature of ENBSeries. Note that without ENBSeries cubemap reflections will be removed altogether. Shades of Skyrim only.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="BlackCubemaps">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="And">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Generic Landscape Patch (SOS)">
							<description>
								For cases in which landscape records from the Water for ENB Master are being overwritten by a later mod and there's no dedicated patch provided. Since this is generic patch it will likely caused minor issues with grass mods and other mods affecting landscape records. Shades of Skyrim only.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="GenericLandscape">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Transparent Horse Trough Water">
							<description>
								Makes the water in horse troughs more transparent. ESL.
							</description>
							<image path="img/10.jpg"/>
							<files>
								<folder source="patches/transparent-trough-water" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Clear Underwater">
							<description>
								Significantly reduces underwater blur (depth of field effect). ESL.
							</description>
							<image path="img/10.jpg"/>
							<files>
								<folder source="patches/clear-underwater" destination=""/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Clear Interior Water">
							<description>
								Makes interior water clear, as it was in early Water for ENB releases. ESL.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="InteriorPatch">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Clear Creek Water (SOS)">
							<description>
								Turns the creek water from Shades of Skyrim into clear bluish water. ESL.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="MudPatch">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Muddy Creek Water (SOS)">
							<description>
								Restores the muddy creek water from version 2.79 and older. ESL.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="RestoreMudPatch">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Less Transparent Water (SOS)">
							<description>
								Depending on your weather mod and ENB preset, water might seem too transparent even with muddiness set to 1.0. In such a case, this option should help.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="LessTransparent">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Darker Volcanic Water">
							<description>
								Reduces the brightness of Volcanic Water, mainly useful for ENB presets that increase water brightness. Wont have any effect in case Blue Volcanic Water is chosen. ESL.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="VolcanicPatch">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Blue" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Wavy" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Teal" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Green" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Vanilla" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Smoother LOD Water">
							<description>
								Distant LOD water is smoother.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="SmoothLOD">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="Optional"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Blue" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Wavy" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Teal" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Green" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Vanilla" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="Less Smooth LOD Water">
							<description>
								Distant LOD water is less smooth.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="LessSmoothLOD">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="Optional"/>
									<patterns>
										<pattern>
											<dependencies operator="Or">
												<flagDependency flag="Shades" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Blue" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Wavy" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Teal" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Green" value="active"/>
												<flagDependency flag="Vanilla" value="active"/>
											</dependencies>
										<type name="Optional"/>
									</pattern>
								</patterns>
							</dependencyType>
						</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>						
						<plugin name="Blue Volcanic Water">
							<description>
								Changes the Volcanic Water color to blue so that it will match the distant LOD water color. Takes priority over Darker Volcanic Water patch when installed together. ESL.
							</description>
							<image path="img/00.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="BlueVolcanicPatch">active</flag>
                            </conditionFlags>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<dependencyType>
									<defaultType name="NotUsable"/>
									<patterns>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
	<moduleName>KS Hairdos - HDT SMP (Physics)</moduleName>
	<moduleImage path="FOMod\KSHairdos.png"/>
	<requiredInstallFiles>
		<folder source="00 Core" destination="" />
	</requiredInstallFiles>
	<installSteps order="Explicit">
		<installStep name="Options">
			<optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
				<group name="Read this!" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Info">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[You must use BodySlide to apply your own body type and preset for the collision!]]>
							</description>
							<image path="FOMod\KSHairdos.png"/>
							<files>
								<folder source="== Installer ==" destination="" priority="0"/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Required"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
				<group name="Options" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Wigs (optional)">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[Installs wigs that can be crafted at the skyforge and given to followers. These are optional. Default body collision is for CBBE - use BodySlide to apply your own body instead!]]>
							</description>
							<image path="FOMod\KSHairdos.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="bWigs">On</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder source="== Installer ==" destination="" priority="0"/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
		<installStep name="Wigs Options">
			<visible>
				<flagDependency flag="bWigs" value="On" />
			</visible>
			<optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
				<group name="Wigs Collision (BodySlide)" type="SelectAny">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="CBBE (default)">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[Installs optional entries in BodySlide for wigs with CBBE collision. Don't forget to build them!]]>
							</description>
							<image path="FOMod\KSHairdos.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="bWigsCBBE">On</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder source="== Installer ==" destination="" priority="0"/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Recommended"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="TBD">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[Installs optional entries in BodySlide for wigs with TBD collision. Don't forget to build them!]]>
							</description>
							<image path="FOMod\KSHairdos.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="bWigsTBD">On</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder source="== Installer ==" destination="" priority="0"/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="BHUNP">
							<description>
								<![CDATA[Installs optional entries in BodySlide for wigs with BHUNP collision. Don't forget to build them!]]>
							</description>
							<image path="FOMod\KSHairdos.png"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="bWigsBHUNP">On</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder source="== Installer ==" destination="" priority="0"/>
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
	</installSteps>
	<conditionalFileInstalls>
		<patterns>
			<pattern>
				<dependencies>
					<flagDependency flag="bWigs" value="On"/>
				</dependencies>
				<files>
					<folder source="01 Wigs" destination=""/>
				</files>
			</pattern>
			<pattern>
				<dependencies>
					<flagDependency flag="bWigs" value="On"/>
					<flagDependency flag="bWigsCBBE" value="On"/>
				</dependencies>
				<files>
					<folder source="10 Wigs BodySlide (CBBE)" destination=""/>
				</files>
			</pattern>
			<pattern>
				<dependencies>
					<flagDependency flag="bWigs" value="On"/>
					<flagDependency flag="bWigsTBD" value="On"/>
				</dependencies>
				<files>
					<folder source="11 Wigs BodySlide (TBD)" destination=""/>
				</files>
			</pattern>
			<pattern>
				<dependencies>
					<flagDependency flag="bWigs" value="On"/>
					<flagDependency flag="bWigsBHUNP" value="On"/>
				</dependencies>
				<files>
					<folder source="12 Wigs BodySlide (BHUNP)" destination=""/>

			</pattern>
		</patterns>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
  <moduleName>No NPC Greetings (Special Edition)</moduleName>
    <installSteps order="Explicit">
		<installStep name="README">
		  <optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
			<group name="Select an option" type="SelectExactlyOne">
			  <plugins order="Explicit">
				<plugin name="README">
				  <description>
					This mod allows you to eliminate NPC greetings altogether. Never will they bother you anymore from a mile away! This mod does affect the distance the NPC's will greet you from. This mod doesn't affect Encounters/Radiant Quests, NPC-to-NPC conversations, Commentaries from your follower, nor NPC's from being arrogant pricks when you do actually talk to them. The inspiration of this mod is from the mod of the same name, authored by Cipscis, from Oldrim / SLE.
				  </description>
				  <image path="fomod\images\Nazeem.png"/>
				  <files>
					<folder source="AA No NPC Greetings - Readme" destination="" priority="1"/>				
				  </files>
				  <typeDescriptor>
					<type name="Optional"/>
				  </typeDescriptor>
				</plugin>
			</plugins>
		  </group>        
		 </optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
		<installStep name="Select an Option">
		  <optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
			<group name="Select an option" type="SelectExactlyOne">
			  <plugins order="Explicit">
				<plugin name="No NPC Greetings">
				  <description>
					Completely eliminates NPC greetings towards the player. 
				  </description>
				  <image path="fomod\images\Nazeem.png"/>
				  <files>
					<folder source="00 No NPC Greetings - No NPC Greetings" destination="" priority="1"/>				
				  </files>
				  <typeDescriptor>
					<type name="Optional"/>
				  </typeDescriptor>
				</plugin>
				<plugin name="Reduced Distance (Recommended)">
				  <description>
					Makes it so that the NPC should literally bump into you first or vice versa to greet you.
				  </description>
				  <image path="fomod\images\Nazeem.png"/>
				  <files>
					<folder source="01 No NPC Greetings - Reduced Distance (Recommended)" destination="" priority="1"/>								
				  </files>
				  <typeDescriptor>
					<type name="Optional"/>
				  </typeDescriptor>
				</plugin>
				<plugin name="Slightly Reduced Distance">
				  <description>
					More immersive, NPC's still greet you but at a closer distance compared to Vanilla. 
				  </description>
				  <image path="fomod\images\Nazeem.png"/>
				  <files>
					<folder source="02 No NPC Greetings - Slightly Reduced Distance" destination="" priority="1"/>								
				  </files>
				  <typeDescriptor>
					<type name="Optional"/>
				  </typeDescriptor>
				</plugin>
				<plugin name="Slightly Reduced Distance xwize version">
				  <description>
					More than Slightly Reduced Distance, but still less than Vanilla.
				  </description>
				  <image path="fomod\images\Nazeem.png"/>
				  <files>
					<folder source="03 No NPC Greetings - Slightly Reduced Distance xwize version" destination="" priority="1"/>								
				  </files>
				  <typeDescriptor>
					<type name="Optional"/>
				  </typeDescriptor>
				</plugin>			
			</plugins>
		  </group>        
		 </optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
		<installStep name="Congratulations! You have finished installing No NPC Greetings.">
		  <optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
			<group name="Select an option" type="SelectExactlyOne">
			  <plugins order="Explicit">
				<plugin name="Complete/Reviews">
				  <description>
					 Should you change your mind later, simply uninstall the mod. This does not contain nor affect any script whatsoever, and thus completely safe to install or uninstall in the middle of a playthrough.See the picture below for some early reviews of the mod! 
				  </description>
				  <image path="fomod\images\reviews.png"/>
				  <files>
					<folder source="AA No NPC Greetings - Readme" destination="" priority="1"/>				
				  </files>
				  <typeDescriptor>
					<type name="Optional"/>
				  </typeDescriptor>
				</plugin>
			</plugins>
		  </group>        
		 </optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>
	</installSteps>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
	<moduleName>Schlongs of Skyrim SE</moduleName>
	<requiredInstallFiles>
		<folder destination="" source="00 Common" />
	</requiredInstallFiles>
	<installSteps order="Explicit">
		<installStep name="Body Type">
			<optionalFileGroups>
				<group name="Body Type" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Default Body">
							<description>
								Install the Default Body mesh, based on Better Males FavoredSoul mesh.
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod/default.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="BodyBuilder">Off</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="00.1 Default" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
						<plugin name="BodyBuilder Body">
							<description>
								Install a more Bulked BodyBuilder Body like mesh, based on Better Males FavoredSoul mesh.
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod/bodybuilder.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="BodyBuilder">On</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>
								<folder destination="" source="00.1 BodyBuilder" />
							</files>
							<typeDescriptor>
								<type name="Optional"/>
							</typeDescriptor>
						</plugin>
					</plugins>
				</group>
			</optionalFileGroups>
		</installStep>

		<installStep name="Skin Texture">
			<visible>
				<flagDependency flag="BodyBuilder" value="Off" /> 
			</visible>
			<optionalFileGroups>
				<group name="Skin Texture" type="SelectExactlyOne">
					<plugins order="Explicit">
						<plugin name="Hairless">
							<description>
								Hairless texture.
							</description>
							<image path="Fomod/default-hairless.jpg"/>
							<conditionFlags>
								<flag name="SkinHair01">On</flag>
							</conditionFlags>
							<files>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://qconsulting.ca/fo3/ModConfig5.0.xsd">
  <moduleName>ENB Light 0.94</moduleName>
  <installSteps order="Explicit">
    <installStep name="ENB Light Main">
      <optionalFileGroups order="Explicit">
        <group name="Select your install type" type="SelectExactlyOne">
          <plugins order="Explicit">
			<plugin name="Candlelight, Magelight, Carry Torch only">
              <description>Install only Candlelight, Magelight, and torch carried by player and NPCs, plus candle light fix.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_torch.jpg"/>
			  <conditionFlags>
				<flag name="FullInstallFlag">Off</flag>
				<flag name="ExtraLight">Off</flag>
			</conditionFlags>
              <files>
                <folder source="01 - Minimal\textures" destination="textures"/>
				<folder source="01 - Minimal\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
				<file source="01 - Minimal\ENB Light.esp" destination="ENB Light.esp"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Full install">
              <description>Full install. Candlelight, Magelight, carry torch and static mounted torches, braziers and campfires. Run the ENBLight Patcher script in zEdit after this install to fix overbright vanilla or mod lights, or use with a mod which allows adjusting light instensity. See Nexus mod page for details.</description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_brazier.jpg"/>
			  	<conditionFlags>
				<flag name="FullInstallFlag">On</flag>
				<flag name="ExtraLight">Off</flag>
			</conditionFlags>
              <files>
                <folder source="01 - Minimal\textures" destination="textures"/>
				<folder source="01 - Minimal\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
				<file source="01 - Minimal\ENB Light.esp" destination="ENB Light.esp"/>
				<folder source="02 - Full\meshes" destination="meshes"/>			
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
		</plugins>
      </group>
        <group name="Additional options - customize your install based on how much fps you can spare" type="SelectAny">
          <plugins order="Explicit">
		  	<plugin name="Minor effects">
              <description>Minor effects like impact spark light and the Torchbug.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_minor.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="09 - MinorFx\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
				<plugin name="Extra light">
              <description>3x light sources for Candlelight, Magelight and carry torch to cover a larger area. 4-5fps additional cost on 1080TI.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_extralight.jpg"/>
			  <conditionFlags>
				<flag name="ExtraLight">On</flag>
				</conditionFlags>
              <files>
				<folder source="03 - Extra Light\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Magic hand effects">
              <description>Add lights to magic hand effects for almost all magic spells. Negligible to little fps cost. Adds variety to some fx for spells which share the same fx in vanilla (currently only for Fire spells).
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_magichandfx.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="10 - MagicHandFx\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
				<file source="10 - MagicHandFx\ENB Light.esp" destination="ENB Light.esp"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Magic effects - Low-Moderate cost">
              <description>Add lights to magic effects for many spells. Fixes some vanilla effects which emit too much light. Details in article on Nexus mod page. Low-Moderate fps cost.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_magicfx.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="15 - MagicFx 0\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Magic weapon effects - fairly low cost">
              <description>Add lights to Bound weapons and the Draugr magic weapons from Labyrinthian. Fairly Low fps cost.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_weapons.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="11 - Weapons\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Fire magic projectiles - Low-Moderate cost">
              <description>Add lights to Flames, Firebolt, Fireball, Incinerate projectiles. Each projectile light ~= 1 torch light. DISABLE Complex Fire Lights to gain performance, my lights account for this.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_firelight.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="16 - Fire Magic Projectiles\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Magic hazards and burning fires - Low to High cost">
              <description>Add lights to magic impacts and burning fires. FPS cost will vary from low to high depending on how many burning fires you have on screen. DISABLE Complex Fire Lights.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_hazards.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="17 - Magic Hazards\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Magic effects - High cost">
              <description>Add lights to Fireball explosion, Flame Wall, Fire Storm, Lightning Storm, Blizzard, Bane of the Undead, Harmony, Mayhem, Unrelenting Force, Fire Breath, Frost Breath, Ice Form, Dismay, Disarm and Dragonrend shouts. DISABLE Complex Fire Lights.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_epicmagicfx.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="19 - Epic Magic\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Dragon fire">
              <description>Add lights to dragon fire. LOTS of light source particles. Dragon fire is very poorly animated in the game, so the lights may look weird at times but so does vanilla dragon fire. Dragon fire impacts/hazards are covered by fire hazard option so you want both for the full experience.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_dragonfire.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="05 - Dragon Fire\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Creatures - Flame Atronachs">
              <description>Add lights to Flame Atronachs. Each is = 1 torchlight.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_atronach.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="18 - Creatures\FlameAtronach\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Creatures - Ice Wraith">
              <description>Add ENB light fx to Ice Wraith.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_icewraith.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="18 - Creatures\IceWraith\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Creatures - Spriggans">
              <description>Add ENB light fx to Spriggans and Spriggan Matrons.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_spriggan.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="18 - Creatures\Spriggans\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Creatures - Wispmother">
              <description>Add ENB light fx to Wispmother.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_wispmother.jpg"/>
              <files>
				<folder source="18 - Creatures\Wispmother\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
		</plugins>
      </group>
	     <group name="Dawnbreaker" type="SelectExactlyOne">
          <plugins order="Explicit">
			<plugin name="NO ENB Light Dawnbreaker">
              <description>Skip Dawnbreaker.
              </description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_dawnbreaker.jpg"/>
              <files>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Lean Wolf's Better Shaped Weapons Dawnbreaker - default sheath">
              <description>Requires Lean Wolf's Better Shaped Weapons - ENB Dawnbreaker default sheath.</description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_dawnbreaker.jpg"/>
              <files>
                <folder source="12 - Dawnbreaker\018 Dawnbreaker ENB\meshes" destination="meshes"/>
              </files>
              <typeDescriptor>
                <type name="Optional"/>
              </typeDescriptor>
            </plugin>
			<plugin name="Lean Wolf's Better Shaped Weapons Dawnbreaker - alt sheath">
              <description>Requires Lean Wolf's Better Shaped Weapons - ENB Dawnbreaker alt sheath.</description>
			  <image path="fomod\images\enbl_mod_dawnbreaker.jpg"/>
              <files>
                <folder source="12 - Dawnbreaker\018aDawnbreakerAlt ENB\meshes" destination="meshes"/>

	<moduleName>XP32 Maximum Skeleton Special Extended</moduleName>

	<installSteps order="Explicit"> 
		<installStep name="Installation"> 
			<optionalFileGroups order="Explicit"> 
				<group name="Installation" type="SelectExactlyOne"> 
					<plugins order="Explicit"> 
						<plugin name="Extended"> 
							<description>Extended installer

Allows to select all features and has full animation support.

See requirements on options or on modpage.</description> 
							<conditionFlags> 
								<flag name="Ext">On</flag> 
							</conditionFlags>

								<folder source="Creature Meshes" destination="" priority="0" /> 
							</files>

								<type name="Optional"/> 
							</typeDescriptor> 
						</plugin>

							<description>Basic installer

Installs a basic version of XPMS(S)E with full animation support.

Requires FNIS or Nemesis.</description> 
							<conditionFlags> 
								<flag name="Ext">Off</flag> 
							</conditionFlags>

							</files>

								<type name="Optional"/> 
							</typeDescriptor> 
						</plugin> 
						<plugin name="Minimal">

								<flag name="Ext">Off</flag>

								<folder source="Character Creation\None" destination="" priority="0" /> 
							</files> 
							<typeDescriptor> 
								<type name="Optional"/> 
							</typeDescriptor> 
						</plugin> 
					</plugins> 
				</group> 
			</optionalFileGroups> 
		</installStep> 
		<installStep name="Rigs">

							<typeDescriptor>

		<installStep name="Additional Features">
